moves.1. e4 d5 2. e5 Bf5 3. f4: One of the most aggresive responses. The only move to save my bishop is...
moves.3... h5 4. d3 e6 5. Nf3: Now black has a somewhat cramped game.
moves.5... c5: Maybe better is Bc5 instead, but I wanted a good center control.
moves.6. Be2 Nc6 7. c3: Good. This contests my center, and set d4 as a resource.
moves.7... Qb6: Inmediately pressing the diagonal. If Be3, Qxb2 is playable.
moves.8. O-O: Just into the fire! But confident because c4+, d4 closes the chances for black.
moves.8... Nh6: I want to keep the black diagonal free for my bishop.
moves.9. Ng5 Ng4: Just to tempt him to BxN, opening the white king.
moves.10. h3 f6: Very risky, but I was playing for fun.
moves.11. hxg4 hxg4: Where is he going to retire the knight? Nxe6, g3, to close the king's movements, no matter the material loss. I lose a pawn, true.
moves.12... fxg5: Recovering my piece, but leaving my own king wide open.
moves.13. fxg5: BxB, QxB, Nxe5, Qe2 was not good for black. If white goes BxB, I'm in trouble.
moves.14. Bxf5 exf5: Rxf5 and the game is over for black, but for some "maybe" tricks: Rxf5, c4+, d4, Nd3... maybe something can come out of it.
moves.15. d4 Ng4: Risking again, knowing that f5 is going to fall, but looking for some way out.
moves.16. Rxf5 Qe6: Otherwise, Qe1+. only apparent sac, since I recover the piece soon.
moves.17. Qxg4 Qe1+ 18. Rf1 Rh1+ 19. Kxh1 Qxf1: Recovering the piece, but in an inferior position, but for Qxb2, winning the rook. Now, white won't be standing still in the meanwhile.
moves.21. Qe6+ Be7 22. Qg8+ Bf8 23. Qe6+ Kd8: Only way to escape pepetual or losing material. Probably, the "exchange" would have favoured me, but it seemed to lead to drawn.
moves.24. Qxd5+: Losing another pawn for the sake of a nice game.
moves.24... Kc7 25. Na3: Bd6+ is not possible because of QxB+, KxB, RxQ. Now I have chance to check. The game stopped here because of connection error. A pity.
moves.25... Qxa1:
or Qf4+, looking helplessly for a perpetual that doesn't exist. Kg1. 
Or: Qxb2, defending from the knight check, R moves, Rd8...
moves.26. Nb5+ Kb6 27. Nd6 Bxd6+ 28. Qxd6+ Kb5: And the game is over for white. Just exploring.
